mission_data.mission_description: Measures for Measures, Supplemental^^This script is solely intended to give players space to experiment with the prototypes seen elsewhere in the Measures for Measures series. It includes installation of the prototypes and summoning of small, basic enemy waves.^^Multi-ship, level selectable, GM Controls, Comms Buttons^v2.8.1+ needed for multi-ship functionality

big_message.title: Prototype Experimentation Mission
big_message.subtitle2: a training module by Neal Schlein, for Artemis 2.8.1

log.text: Measures for Measures Supplement: Prototype Experimentation

set_ship_text.name: Prototypes
set_ship_text.desc: MULTI-SHIP OPTIONS^Upgrade Shields: +20% Boost.^Extra Coolant: +25% coolant.^^SINGLE SHIP OPTIONS^Demagnetized Hull: Bypass mines. ^Bio-Weapon: Deploy pods of Piranhas.^Enemy Transponder: "Change" sides.^Shield Buffer: Boost shields & energy after combat.^Decoy Signal: Deploy decoy ships.^Angled Shields: Adjust shield power.^Organic Repairs: Regenerating repair systems.

set_ship_text.desc: No prototype installed on this ship.

event.name: Info Mesh 7
event.incoming_comms_text: All ships, be aware that pirate warp signatures have been detected.

set_ship_text.name: Ship 8
set_ship_text.desc: No prototype installed on this ship.

log.text: The starship Artemis has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.
The starship Intrepid has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.
The starship Aegis has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.
The starship Horatio has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.
The starship Excalibur has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.
The starship Hera has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.
The starship Ceres has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.
The starship Diana has arrived at the edge of the Trithel Nebula.

event.name: Mission Orders
event.incoming_comms_text: This mission is for you to experiment with a set of prototype weapons and defensive systems introduced and used in the Measures for Measures mission series (specifically, Disparate Measures and Countered Measures.)^^This should be particularly beneficial for new players.^^To begin, ock with the Testing Station and select an upgrade. There will be detailed information available on the Science and Captains screen once an option is selected (look at "Ship #"). ^^Please be aware that the upgrade menu options are presented to one ship at a time, and most options can only be installed on one ship at a time. After an option is selected by the active ship, a menu will appear for the next ship to dock.^^Upgrades can be removed and exchanged in order to test multiple systems. You can summon a new enemy wave after complete destruction/surrender of the current enemy set.

set_ship_text.name: Request Specs
set_ship_text.desc: Scan to send specs for all upgrades to Comms.

event.name: Send Specs to Comms
event.incoming_comms_text: New Skaraan Technology Overview--^^Gravimetric Torpedos ^**Reduce target's maximum shielding capacity^**Negate ship velocity upon impact^**May cause direct damage (reports vary)^**Can create localized tears in space-time^**Non-Targetable^**Limited duration^^Warp Negation Technology^**Based on Trithel Particles^**Overloads warp fields^**Deployment observed on stations^^Non-Magnetic Hull Materials^**Equipped ships do not trigger mines
Spec Sheet: Organic Circuitry^^--Damage repair systems regenerate naturally.^--1 random team will regenerate 1 member each minute.^--Full regeneration cycle takes 18 minutes+^

Spec Sheets: Angled Shields^^--Angle shields to front, rear, or evenly balanced^--Front focus: 150% forward / 50% rear^--Rear focus: 50% forward / 150% rear^--Balanced: 100% forward / 100% rear^--Deflects gravitational damage^^NOTE: Minor transfer loss will result in temporary reduction of overall shield strength. ^^Successive quick changes are not recommended during combat.

Spec Sheets: Sensor Decoys^^--Deploys two distortion beacons enhanced with basic weapons and thrusters^--Beacons may be directed as per normal allied ships^--Beacons will be destroyed upon taking any damage^--Beacon Power Duration: 2 minutes

Spec Sheet: Shield Buffer^^--Requires Shields to be raised for activation.^--Buffer cycles every 5 seconds.^--After deactivation, boosts shields by (1/20 of damage taken) x (total activated cycles), compounded.^--Upon deactivation, restores ship energy based upon number of activated cycles (10/cycle, compounded).^--Generates heat in all engineering subsystems (increases with length of activation)

Spec Sheets: False Transponder^^--Ship broadcasts enemy ID signal.^--Temporarily appears to be part of enemy fleet.^--Duration varies (appx. 15-30 seconds).^--Passive reset scans require 5 minutes.^--Can confuse drones and unguided missiles.^^NOTE: Allied ships and stations will react according to perceived ID signal.
Spec Sheet: Bio Weapon (Pods)^^--Rear-deploys a fake wreck loaded with 3 piranhas.^--4 pods installed; additional stores upon redock^--Requires proximity triggering by a TSN ship.^
Spec Sheet: Coolant Upgrade^^--+2 total Engineering Coolant^--Immediate and permanent addition

Spec Sheet: Mine Bypass^^--Temporarily demagnetizes hull (appx. 15 seconds)^--Ship will not trigger mines while demagnetized.^--Requires recharge after use, appx. 3 minutes^^Note: Mines can still be exploded by other nearby ships.
Spec Sheet: Shield Boost^^--20% boost to maximum front shields^--20% boost to maximum rear shields^--Immediate increase, based upon current maximum strength.

Prototype Overview^^--Shield Boost (20% increase to each shield.)^^--Mine Bypass (Temporarily allows ship to fly near mines.)^^--Coolant Upgrade (+25% Engineering Coolant.)^^--Bio Weapon (Deploys a wreck with piranhas; 4 uses. Requires triggering.)^^--False Transponder (Broadcasts enemy ID signal.)^^--Shield Buffer (Stores energy from damaged shields for power and shield recharge. Generates heat.)^^--Sensor Decoys (Deploy two commandable sensor decoys for 2 minutes.)^^--Shield Angling (Focus shield deflectors to front, back, or balanced.)^^--Organic Circuitry (Self-regenerating Damcon teams.)

set_ship_text.name: Prototypes
set_ship_text.desc: MULTI-SHIP OPTIONS^Upgrade Shields: +20% Boost.^Extra Coolant: +25% coolant.^^SINGLE SHIP OPTIONS^Demagnetized Hull: Bypass mines. ^Bio-Weapon: Deploy pods of Piranhas.^Enemy Transponder: "Change" sides.^Shield Buffer: Boost shields & energy after combat.^Decoy Signal: Deploy decoy ships.^Angled Shields: Adjust shield power.^Organic Repairs: Regenerating repair systems.

folder_arme.name: Per Ship Upgrade Offer Trigger and Dock Failure

event.name: Multi-Ship Upgrade Choice 1

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Enhanced Shield Generators^[Automatic}^^Boosts maximum front and rear shields by 20% each. ^^Note: Do not remove if stress damage has been incurred.

event.incoming_comms_text: A shield booster is being installed, but we have more of them.

event.name: One-Ship Upgrade Choice 2

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Demagnetized Hull^ CURRENT STATE: READY^[Comms Activated]^^Vessel will not trigger mines while active. ^^ Duration: ~17 seconds ^Recharge: 3 minutes

event.incoming_comms_text: The Mine Bypass upgrade has been taken.

event.name: Multi-Ship Upgrade Choice 3

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Hyper-Compressed Coolant.^[Engineering Controlled]^^Boosts total available coolant by 25%.

event.incoming_comms_text: We are installing an Extra Coolant module, but have more of them.

event.name: One-Ship Upgrade Choice 4

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Bio Pods (x4) ^[Comms Activated]^^Deploys pod with 3 Piranhas.^^Location: 600m to ship aft. ^Trigger Delay: 7 Seconds ^Requires proximity detonation, 1500m ^Reload: 30 seconds.

event.incoming_comms_text: The Bio Pods are being installed on a ship. Glad to have them out of the cargo bay!

event.name: One-Ship Upgrade Choice 5

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: False Transponder^CURRENT STATE: READY ^[Comms Activated] ^^Masks ship signal and broadcasts enemy ID code. ^^Duration: 20-30 seconds ^Reset: 5 minutes. ^^WARNING: Equipped ship is treated as enemy for all purposes when active. ^^May cause missiles or drones to re-target.

event.incoming_comms_text: The spoofed transponder is being installed on a ship. Can't wait to see how you use it!!

event.name: One-Ship Upgrade Choice 6

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Shield Buffer^CURRENT STATE: READY^^[Active Shields Required]^[Comms Activated]^^Buffers power in Engineering subsystems; deactivate to restore shields and energy. ^NOTE: Generates increasing heat.^NOTE: Not rated for 7+ cycles.^^Cycle Time: 5 seconds ^Energy Recovery: 10 units/cycle/cycle ^Shield Recovery: 5% averaged damage/cycle ^Reset Discharge: 15 seconds/cycle

event.incoming_comms_text: The Shield Buffer has been taken and is being installed.

event.name: One-Ship Upgrade Choice 7

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Deploy Decoys^[Comms Activated]^^Deploy two un-armed escort "ships" to aft. ^Comms directable ^^Duration: 2 minute power supply, eliminated upon shield damage. ^^Note: Requires resupply at station.

event.incoming_comms_text: The Sensor Decoy system has been taken and is being installed.

event.name: One-Ship Upgrade Choice 8

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Angled Deflectors^[Current State: BALANCED]^[Comms Controlled] ^^Can be Balanced, Forward, or Rear.^ Selected Shield Max is raised 50%, reverse shield reduced by 50%; transfers partial strength to active shield. ^^Mitigates gravitational damage upon reset.^^Exchange Bonus: +50% Maximum, +45% of reverse shield strength ^^Exchange Loss: -50% Maximum, -50% to reverse shield strength

event.incoming_comms_text: The Angled Shields module has been taken and is being installed.

event.name: One-Ship Upgrade Choice 9

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Organic Repair Circuitry ^[Automatic]^^Damaged repair systems regenerate capacity with time.^^Rate: Restores capacity of up to 1 Damcom member/minute

event.incoming_comms_text: The Organic Circuitry is being installed on a ship.

log.text: False transponder activated. Initiating False-Flag operation.

event.name: Change Transponder Signal FAIL
event.incoming_comms_text: Credentials Rejected

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: False Transponder^CURRENT STATE: CREDENTIALS REJECTED^[Comms Activated] ^^Masks ship signal and broadcasts enemy ID code. ^^Duration: 20-30 seconds ^Reset: 5 minutes. ^^WARNING: Equipped ship is treated as enemy for all purposes when active. ^^May cause missiles or drones to re-target.

log.text: False transponder activated. Initiating False-Flag operation.

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Shield Buffer^CURRENT STATE: READY^^[Active Shields Required]^[Comms Activated]^^Buffers power in Engineering subsystems; deactivate to restore shields and energy. ^NOTE: Generates increasing heat.^NOTE: Not rated for 7+ cycles.^^Cycle Time: 5 seconds ^Energy Recovery: 10 units/cycle/cycle ^Shield Recovery: 5% averaged damage/cycle ^Reset Discharge: 15 seconds/cycle

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Shield Buffer^CURRENT STATE: ACTIVE^^[Active Shields Required]^[Comms Activated]^^Buffers power in Engineering subsystems; deactivate to restore shields and energy. ^NOTE: Generates increasing heat.^NOTE: Not rated for 7+ cycles.^^Cycle Time: 5 seconds ^Energy Recovery: 10 units/cycle/cycle ^Shield Recovery: 5% averaged damage/cycle ^Reset Discharge: 15 seconds/cycle

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Shield Buffer^CURRENT STATE: OVERLOADED^^[Active Shields Required]^[Comms Activated]^^Buffers power in Engineering subsystems; deactivate to restore shields and energy. ^NOTE: Generates increasing heat.^NOTE: Not rated for 7+ cycles.^^Cycle Time: 5 seconds ^Energy Recovery: 10 units/cycle/cycle ^Shield Recovery: 5% averaged damage/cycle ^Reset Discharge: 15 seconds/cycle

log.text: Shield Buffer safety margin exceeded and system overloaded. Total ship shutdown. Shields and power dropped to 9, speed and warp off, all power settings to 0 until buffer discharged.

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Shield Buffer^CURRENT STATE: DISCHARGING^^[Active Shields Required]^[Comms Activated]^^Buffers power in Engineering subsystems; deactivate to restore shields and energy. ^NOTE: Generates increasing heat.^NOTE: Not rated for 7+ cycles.^^Cycle Time: 5 seconds ^Energy Recovery: 10 units/cycle/cycle ^Shield Recovery: 5% averaged damage/cycle ^Reset Discharge: 15 seconds/cycle

set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Shield Buffer^CURRENT STATE: DISCHARGING^^[Active Shields Required]^[Comms Activated]^^Buffers power in Engineering subsystems; deactivate to restore shields and energy. ^NOTE: Generates increasing heat.^NOTE: Not rated for 7+ cycles.^^Cycle Time: 5 seconds ^Energy Recovery: 10 units/cycle/cycle ^Shield Recovery: 5% averaged damage/cycle ^Reset Discharge: 15 seconds/cycle

log.text: Positive shield and power recharge initiated.

set_ship_text.name: Decoy 1
set_ship_text.hailtext: The prototype designers would like to thank Admiral UE, and want to remind everyone not to make assumptions.

set_ship_text.name: Decoy 2
set_ship_text.hailtext: Congratulations! You found the Easter Egg. I recommend figuring out how to dock with the enemy stations.

set_ship_text.name: Decoy 1
set_ship_text.desc: Decoy Signal

set_ship_text.name: Decoy 2
set_ship_text.desc: Decoy Signal

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Angled Deflectors^[Current State: FORWARD]^[Comms Controlled] ^^Can be Balanced, Forward, or Rear.^ Selected Shield Max is raised 50%, reverse shield reduced by 50%; transfers partial strength to active shield. ^^Mitigates gravitational damage upon reset.^^Exchange Bonus: +50% Maximum, +45% of current reverse shield strength ^^Exchange Loss: -50% Maximum, -50% reverse shield strength

log.text: Deflector shields set to forward angle (150% front, 50% rear).

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Angled Deflectors^[Current State: REAR]^[Comms Controlled] ^^Can be Balanced, Forward, or Rear.^ Selected Shield Max is raised 50%, reverse shield reduced by 50%; transfers partial strength to active shield. ^^Mitigates gravitational damage upon reset.^^Exchange Bonus: +50% Maximum, +45% of current reverse shield strength ^^Exchange Loss: -50% Maximum, -50% reverse shield strength

log.text: Deflector shields set to rear angle (50% front, 150% rear).

set_ship_text.name: Ship |updateInfo|
set_ship_text.desc: Prototype Installed: Angled Deflectors^[Current State: BALANCED]^[Comms Controlled] ^^Can be Balanced, Forward, or Rear.^ Selected Shield Max is raised 50%, reverse shield reduced by 50%; transfers partial strength to active shield. ^^Mitigates gravitational damage upon reset.^^Exchange Bonus: +50% Maximum, +22% of current reverse shield strength ^^Exchange Loss: -50% Maximum, -75% current shield strength

log.text: Deflector shields set to Balanced (100% front, 100% rear).
